title: Trump discussing 'range of options' for Greenland, including military
subhead: The president is looking at a number of ideas for acquiring the self-governing Danish territory and using the US military is 'always an option,' the White House said on Tuesday. Earlier, Greenland and Denmark called for a speedy meeting with US Secretary of State Marco Rubio after Trump's renewed claims on Greenland.

title: Ukraine: Western allies agree on key security guarantees in Paris
subhead: Following the largest yet meeting of the so-called Coalition of the Willing in Paris, European leaders and the US hailed progress. The security guarantees include a US-led monitoring mechanism and a European multinational force that would be deployed after a ceasefire in Russia's war against its neighbor.

title: Trump says Venezuela 'turning over' up to 50 million barrels of oil to US: 'That money will be controlled by me'
subhead: The 'President of the United States of America,' as he referred to himself in his Truth Social post on Tuesday, said he will 'ensure it is used to benefit the people of Venezuela and the United States.'

title: Venezuela: Iran risks losing a key economic and military ally
subhead: Tehran and Caracas have maintained close ties, particularly as a way to circumvent sanctions targeting both countries. The Islamic Republic, which is itself under threat from Washington, has projected a surface-level optimism.

title: 'If tomorrow, the US decides to seize Greenland, neither Denmark nor the EU has the means to stop it'
subhead: Donald Trump's military operation in Venezuela should show Europeans that the US is a predator for Europe, just like Russia and China, argues former United Nations under-secretary-general Jean-Marie Guéhenno.

Maduro, the failed heir to Hugo Chavez's Bolivarian Revolution
subhead: The Venezuelan president, recently abducted by the US, was chosen by Hugo Chavez as his successor and narrowly elected in 2013. Over 13 years in power, he has eliminated political opposition, tightened control over state institutions and overseen a 70% collapse in GDP as a quarter of Venezuelans fled the country.

title: US attack on Venezuela: What does international law say?
subhead: According to international law, 'fighting drug trafficking and protecting democracy do not constitute legal grounds for the use of force.'

title: Maduro capture marks new blow to dying international order
subhead: Venezuela's allies condemned an 'illegal act of aggression' while countries aligned with the US urged restraint but sought to avoid directly criticizing Donald Trump.

title: Greenland is and must remain European
The return of the US's predatory imperialism
'Trump and Putin share a common enemy, liberal Europe, but they have two divergent strategic projects'
